column19: To the shareholders of Newco Scanbox Denmark ApS
column23: The annual report is presented in accordance with the Danish Financial Statements Act.
column24: In our opinion, the financial statements give a true and fair view of the Entityâs financial position at 31.12.2017 and of the results of its operations  and cash flows for the financial year 01.01.2017 - 31.12.2017.
column28: Referring to section 99a of the Danish Financial Statements Act, the Group has no politics regarding social responsibility
column29: Current tax payable or receivable is recognised in the balance sheet, stated as tax calculated on this year's taxable income, adjusted for prepaid tax.
column30: Dividend is recognised as a liability at the time of adoption at the general meeting. Proposed dividend for the financial year is disclosed as a separate item in equity.
column31: Depreciation, amortisation and impairment losses relating to intangible assets and property, plant and equipment comprise amortisation, depreciation and impairment losses for the financial year, calculated on the basis of the residual values and useful lives of the individual assets and impairment testing as well as gains and losses from the sale of intangible assets as well as property, plant and equipment
column32: Cash comprises cash in hand and bank deposits.
column33: Cost of sales comprises goods consumed in the financial year measured at cost, adjusted for ordinary inventory writedowns.
column34: Prepayments comprise incurred costs relating to subsequent financial years. Prepayments are measured at cost.
column35: Deferred income comprises income received for recognition in subsequent financial years. Deferred income is measured at cost.
column36: Staff costs comprise salaries and wages as well as social security contributions, pension contributions, etc for entity staff.
column37: Other external expenses include expenses relating to the Entityâs ordinary activities, including expenses for premises, stationery and office supplies, marketing costs, etc. This item also includes writedowns of receivables recognised in current assets.
column38: Income from investments in group enterprises comprises the pro rata share of the individual enterprisesâ profit/loss after full elimination of internal profits or losses.
column39: Gross profit or loss comprises revenue, changes in inventories of finished goods and work in progress, own work capitalised, other operating income, cost of raw materials and consumables and external expenses.
column40: Other financial liabilities are measured at amortised cost, which usually corresponds to nominal value.
column41: Other operating income comprises income of a secondary nature as viewed in relation to the Entityâs primary activities, including rental income and gains from the sale of intangible assets and property, plant and equipment.
column42: Receivables are measured at amortised cost, usually equalling nominal value less writedowns for bad and doubtful debts.
column43: Revenue from the sale of manufactured goods and goods for resale is recognised in the income statement when delivery is made and risk has passed to the buyer. Revenue is recognised net of VAT, duties and sales discounts and is measured at fair value of the consideration fixed.
column44: The Groupâs key business activity is to acquire licensing rights to feature films and similar rights related to the entertainment business for distribution in the Nordic and European markets.
column45: We conducted our audit in accordance with International Standards on Auditing (ISAs) and the additional requirements applicable in Denmark. Our responsibilities under those standards and requirements are further described in the Auditorâs responsibilities for the audit of the consolidated financial statements and the parent financial statements section of this auditorâs report. We are independent of the Group in accordance with the International Ethics Standards Board of Accountants' Code of Ethics for Professional Accountants (IESBA Code) and the additional requirements applicable in Denmark, and we have fulfilled our other ethical responsibilities in accordance with these requirements. We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our opinion.
column46: There is no actual research and development activities in the Group.
column47: No events have occurred after the balance sheet date to this date, which would influence the evaluation of this annual report.
column48: Newco Scanbox Denmark ApSâ companies face ordinary industry-specific risks. Besides those risks, no special risks are considered to exist for the Group's activities. Management regularly seeks to hedge the risks to which the Group is exposed.
column49: The accounting policies applied to these consolidated financial statements and parent financial statements are consistent with those applied last year, however, with minor restatements of the comparative figures to ensure comparability between the two financial years.
column50: The Group has a deferred tax asset of DKK 4,9m relating to tax losses which, taking into consideration the uncertainty of the utilisation thereof within a period of 3-5 years, has not been capitalised.
column51: Negative goodwill on acquisition of investments.
column52: Of international licensing rights to films, DKK 10.6 mio. concerns prepayments on movies not yet delivered.
column54: Prepayments comprise prepaid expenses at the balance sheet date.
column58: The Board of Directors and the Executive Board have today considered and approved the annual report of Newco Scanbox Denmark ApS for the financial year 01.01.2017 - 31.12.2017.
column63: Lease payments on operating leases are recognised on a straight-line basis in the income statement over the term of the lease.
column64: The Entity is not subject to controlling influence from related parties.
column67: We believe that the management commentary contains a fair review of the affairs and conditions referred to therein.
column84: We recommend the annual report for adoption at the Annual General Meeting.
